alert.note: Alert for Graham; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:03PM MST until July 28 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON FOR WEST CENTRAL GRAHAM AND EAST CENTRAL PINAL COUNTIES... At 103 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area with between 1 and 3 inches of rain recorded. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar estimates over 2.6 inches of rain has fallen in the upper Turkey Creek and Sycamore Canyon drainages. Heavy rain has ended however high water is still expected to be moving down Aravaipa Creek as it eventually makes its way to the San Pedro River. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Aravaipa Canyon Wilderness. This includes the following streams and drainages... Aravaipa Creek, Turkey Creek and Fourmile Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
